snippet: The money-losing airline was placed under control of a bankruptcy trustee, prompting creditors to begin seizing its planes outside the country.
abstract: Hungarian national airline, Malev, halts all flights, and is put under control of a bankruptcy trustee; creditors begin seizing its planes outside the country.

byline.original: By NICOLA CLARK and DAVID JOLLY

lead_paragraph: The money-losing airline was placed under control of a bankruptcy trustee, prompting creditors to begin seizing its planes outside the country.

headline.print_headline: Hungary’s Malev Airlines Grounds Flights After Creditors Seize Its Planes
